abstract: Christopher Gray Streetscapes column answers readers' questions about the histories of two demolished Manhattan structures, the 1902 State Bank headquarters building at 374 Grand Street, and 716 Fifth Avenue in Manhattan, built in 1910 for Schumann Sons jewelers.
snippet: Readers inquire about a demolished jewelry store at 716 Fifth Avenue and a demolished bank at 374 Grand Street.
lead_paragraph: Readers inquire about a demolished jewelry store at 716 Fifth Avenue and a demolished bank at 374 Grand Street.

headline.main: A Bank Lives On in Memory and Metal
headline.print_headline: A Bank Lives On In Memory and Metal
headline.seo: Streetscapes/Readers’ Questions - A Bank Lives On, in Memory and Metal
